channel.title: [vps] help = really in needed or my server gets down!
channel.description: So I got a VPS and gave my coder acces to it and now he quited helping and fucked with it, he changed the pass, deleted the source etc. How do I change a pass from a VPS? I bought it on vpsland.com

item.title: [vps] help = really in needed or my server gets down!
item.dc:creator: @I_am_beast I am beast
item.description:
@I_am_beast wrote:

Nope, these suggestions maybe helpful, but they aren’t the best options. You would have receive and email with a control panel link. Some thing like http://65.189.258.65:3794 or something that looks similar. You just click on that, and it opens the control panel, that you need to log on to, using the password you registered with. Hope this helps.

Read full topic
item.source: [vps] help = really in needed or my server gets down!

item.title: [vps] help = really in needed or my server gets down!
item.dc:creator: @Shadowspkin Shadowspkin
item.description:
@Shadowspkin wrote:

I will disagree, I work alot as coder for someone and I actually think its a MAJOR thing for the coder to have VPS access makes are job alot easyer…But like before its pretty easy to get the password back you just got to know your info

Read full topic

item.title: [vps] help = really in needed or my server gets down!
item.dc:creator: @Vexillum Vexillum
item.description:
@Vexillum wrote:

I agree: NEVER TRUST PEOPLE ONLINE! I would just upload the source and give it to the coder and he can do what he needs to do then he sends it back to you.

Tell them to switch you to a 64 bit or a 32bit <-- Depending on what your on allready,: D

item.title: [vps] help = really in needed or my server gets down!
item.dc:creator: @Enyo Enyo
item.description:
@Enyo wrote:

Phone them up a direct conversation with them normally works, or close the vps down so he cant fuck with it again. Cant you login to the control panel and change the password that way. NEVER TRUST PEOPLE ONLINE!. Good luck mate.

Read full topic
